ticket.title: to_xml datetime format regression
ticket.original-body:
Rails 3.0.3 incorrectly formats datetime fields unless the record is reloaded from the database. The following gist provides the test case and possible fix: https://gist.github.com/722889
More info and Rails 3.0.0 comparison: https://gist.github.com/720887
ticket.latest-body:

ticket.original-body-html:
Rails 3.0.3 incorrectly formats datetime fields unless the record is reloaded from the database. The following gist provides the test case and possible fix: https://gist.github.com/722889

I believed it uggs classic cardy was a simple topic with a very simple proposition. With a firm belief in myself, I tried to pen a few bailey button fancy words. I found myself helpless as I had fiddled away precious bailey button uggs time. Apparently an innocuous proposition made me ponder, which began in a cheap ugg boots argyle listless way and later took a definite direction.As my thought process gained some classic argyle knit ugg boots ground, I could not fathom the depth of this topic nor scale the uggs mini height of it. At one time I thought it could be dealt by filling the write up with anecdotes of my short mini uggs life and thus proving Life is Beautiful. The very next instance made me shudder, as a serious ugg boots ultra topic should be dealt philosophically. A chain developed with one approach giving way to the other.As we grew old ugg ultra tall boots sale together, I would tease you that you had not changed since we first met. But it is true, my uggs tall women darling. I do not see the wrinkles and grey hair that other people see. When I look at you ugg black classic tall sale now, I only see your sweet tender lips and youthful sparkling eyes as we sat and had out first picnic next black short ugg to that small stream, and chased each other around ugg black short that big old oak tree. I remember wishing those sundance ugg boots first few days together would last forever. Do you remember how exciting and wonderful those chestnut ugg boots nightfall days were? ZHC

version.body:
I've been investigating this, and it looks like if you set `ActiveRecord::Base.time_zone_aware_attributes` to true, the problem goes away.
I checked out the v3.0.0 tag, and this test also fails in Rails 3.0.0.
Here is a video of the test failing on 3.0.0:
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nrrWA7c9L1c
Here is a video of the test passing with time zone aware attributes:
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Q3UV-oCEmP4
I'm not convinced that there has been a regression during Rails 3.0.x. I do agree this is strange behavior. Given the "time_zone_aware_attributes" method, I wonder if this strange behavior is expected? It seems to me "time_zone_aware_attributes" should *always* be set to true, shouldn't it?
version.body-html:
I've been investigating this, and it looks like if you set ActiveRecord::Base.time_zone_aware_attributes to true, the problem goes away.

I checked out the v3.0.0 tag, and this test also fails in Rails 3.0.0.

Here is a video of the test failing on 3.0.0:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nrrWA7c9L1c

Here is a video of the test passing with time zone aware attributes:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Q3UV-oCEmP4

I'm not convinced that there has been a regression during Rails 3.0.x. I do agree this is strange behavior. Given the "time_zone_aware_attributes" method, I wonder if this strange behavior is expected? It seems to me "time_zone_aware_attributes" should always be set to true, shouldn't it?
version.title: to_xml datetime format regression

version.body:
Ah, and I was about to submit a patch :-). I'm happy with ActiveRecord::Base.time_zone_aware_attributes approach and it certainly makes sense to set it to true by default.
I haven't run the tests against 3.0.0 so it's hard to say why they fail without looking into it (maybe Base.time_zone_aware_attributes should be explicitly set). But in any case, I've noticed this whole formatting discrepancy because of failing specs in my app after Rails 3.0.3 upgrade.
version.body-html:
Ah, and I was about to submit a patch :-). I'm happy with ActiveRecord::Base.time_zone_aware_attributes approach and it certainly makes sense to set it to true by default.

I haven't run the tests against 3.0.0 so it's hard to say why they fail without looking into it (maybe Base.time_zone_aware_attributes should be explicitly set). But in any case, I've noticed this whole formatting discrepancy because of failing specs in my app after Rails 3.0.3 upgrade.
version.title: to_xml datetime format regression

version.body: Seems ActiveRecord::Base.time_zone_aware_attributes is set to true by default. But I still get the error when it is set to true as it was in my project. Adding 'raw_value = raw_value.in_time_zone if raw_value.respond_to?(:in_time_zone)' as Mike suggests in his gist fixes the problem. But that is not necessary in 3.0.1 where this problem does not occur. Strange. What could be the cause? Also, as mention in ticket [6054](https://rails.lighthouseapp.com/projects/8994/tickets/6054-datetime-in-to_xml-returns-gmt-from-302) this problem does not occur with to_json.
version.body-html:
Seems ActiveRecord::Base.time_zone_aware_attributes is set to true by default. But I still get the error when it is set to true as it was in my project.
Adding 'raw_value = raw_value.in_time_zone if raw_value.respond_to?(:in_time_zone)' as Mike suggests in his gist fixes the problem. But that is not necessary in 3.0.1 where this problem does not occur. Strange. What could be the cause? Also, as mention in ticket 6054 this problem does not occur with to_json.
version.title: to_xml datetime format regression

version.title: to_xml datetime format regression

version.body:
Aaron, unfortunately flipping ActiveRecord::Base.time_zone_aware_attributes doesn't seem to affect datetime formatting. Please see https://gist.github.com/734332 (view raw).
Let me follow-up with a patch...
version.body-html:
Aaron, unfortunately flipping ActiveRecord::Base.time_zone_aware_attributes doesn't seem to affect datetime formatting. Please see https://gist.github.com/734332 (view raw).

Let me follow-up with a patch...
version.title: to_xml datetime format regression

version.body: Mike: thanks for the update, but with your patch keep in mind that the fix you provided earlier by changing the value in ActiveModel::Serializers::Xml::Serializer::Attribute was not necessary in earlier versions. So I assume the problem must originate somewhere else?
version.body-html: Mike: thanks for the update, but with your patch keep in mind that the fix you provided earlier by changing the value in ActiveModel::Serializers::Xml::Serializer::Attribute was not necessary in earlier versions. So I assume the problem must originate somewhere else?
version.title: to_xml datetime format regression

version.body:
(from [f572a02b94ce85bb8db64e838aa159cf3ef4b1fa]) Take into account current time zone when serializing datetime values [#6096 state:resolved]
Signed-off-by: José Valim <jose.valim@gmail.com> https://github.com/rails/rails/commit/f572a02b94ce85bb8db64e838aa159cf3ef4b1fa
version.body-html:
(from [f572a02b94ce85bb8db64e838aa159cf3ef4b1fa]) Take into account current time zone when serializing datetime values [#6096 state:resolved]

Signed-off-by: José Valim jose.valim@gmail.com
https://github.com/rails/rails/commit/f572a02b94ce85bb8db64e838aa15...
version.title: to_xml datetime format regression
